meanings.definition: A large, disorderly crowd of people.
meanings.sent1: The mobs gathered outside the stadium, cheering loudly.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were filled with mobs celebrating the victory.
meanings.sent3: The mobs at the concert were so excited, they started dancing in the aisles.
meanings.sent4: The mobs of shoppers swarmed the store like a wave of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mobs chanting together will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are linked by a common interest or activity.
meanings.sent1: Our book club is a close-knit mobs that meets every week.
meanings.sent2: The mobs of volunteers worked tirelessly to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The mobs of gamers were so focused on the competition, they didn't notice the time passing.
meanings.sent4: The mobs of hikers moved together like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The mobs of fans shared a deep passion for the music of the band.

meanings.definition: To crowd around someone or something in an unruly way.
meanings.sent1: The excited fans mobs around the celebrity for autographs.
meanings.sent2: The reporters mobs around the politician to ask questions.
meanings.sent3: The kids mobs around the ice cream truck, eager for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The paparazzi mobs the actress, trying to get the perfect shot.
meanings.sent5: The students mobs the teacher with questions after class.
